summary: This document is an email chain from April 2020 between FBI public affairs specialists discussing a media inquiry from MailOnline UK. The inquiry asks the FBI to confirm if a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request was sent to the UK to question Prince Andrew regarding the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The FBI's consistent response is 'no comment'.

persons.name: Amy J. Thoreson
persons.role: Public Affairs Specialist, FBI New York
persons.context: FBI public affairs specialist involved in handling media inquiries about the Epstein investigation and the MLAT request regarding Prince Andrew.

persons.name: Tina D. Jagerson
persons.role: Public Affairs Specialist, FBI National Press Office
persons.context: FBI national press office specialist who forwarded the media inquiry about Prince Andrew and Epstein to Amy Thoreson, seeking confirmation on the response course.

persons.name: Vivek Chaudhary
persons.context: Journalist who emailed the FBI's National Press Office to inquire if an MLAT request was sent to the UK to question Prince Andrew as part of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: British royal who is the subject of a reported FBI MLAT request to the UK authorities as part of the Jeffrey Epstein inquiry.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the criminal investigation that the FBI's MLAT request regarding Prince Andrew is connected to.

persons.name: Kirsty Hayes
persons.context: Named by the reporter as the UK Home Office director to whom the alleged FBI MLAT request regarding Prince Andrew was sent.

connections.description: FBI public affairs specialists coordinating on media response strategy regarding the Epstein investigation and Prince Andrew inquiry.
Prince Andrew is named as a person the FBI sought to question via an MLAT request in connection with the Jeffrey Epstein investigation.

events.title: MailOnline Inquiry to FBI
events.description: Reporter Vivek Chaudhary emails the FBI National Press Office asking for confirmation if an MLAT request was sent to the UK to question Prince Andrew regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FBI Internal Email Correction on MLAT
events.description: An FBI email corrects a prior statement, confirming an MLAT was indeed sent to the UK requesting information from Prince Andrew regarding Epstein and the investigation.

locations: New York (FBI New York field office context)
UK (United Kingdom, the recipient country of the alleged MLAT request)
keyFacts: An FBI email from April 16, 2020, confirms a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request was sent to the United Kingdom seeking information from Prince Andrew regarding Jeffrey Epstein and the investigation.
The FBI's standard and repeated response to media inquiries about this matter was 'no comment'.
The media inquiry originated from MailOnline UK reporter Vivek Chaudhary, who cited a source claiming the MLAT request was sent to Kirsty Hayes, a director in the UK Home Office.

The email chain reveals internal FBI coordination between the National Press Office in Washington, DC, and the New York field office on how to handle sensitive media questions about the Epstein investigation and Prince Andrew.
